subject: Business
title: Free Trade Agreements and Tariffs
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Free Trade Agreements and Tariffs.

hook.text: A 25% tariff on Chinese goods added $800 to the cost of a shipping container overnight. Supply chains scrambled.

buildup.text: Tariffs are taxes on imports. Free trade agreements remove or reduce them between partner countries.

discovery.text: NAFTA (now USMCA) eliminated most tariffs between the US, Canada, and Mexico, creating a massive free trade zone.

twist.text: Trade wars use tariffs as weapons. The US-China trade war disrupted supply chains that took decades to build.

climax.text: Companies now 'friend-shore' â€” shifting production to allied countries to reduce tariff and political risk.

punchline.text: Tariffs change the math. Supply chains follow the math.

quiz.question: What is 'friend-shoring'?
options: Shifting production to allied countries to reduce geopolitical risk
Building warehouses near the coast for faster shipping
Sharing supply chain data with competitors
